00012 #include "MethodFunctor.h"
00013 
00014 #include <list>
00015 
00016 namespace Util
00017 {
00018 
00019    using std::list;
00020 
00021    // -----------------------------------------------------------------
00022    // Signal with one argument.
00023 
00037    template <typename T=void>
00038    class Signal
00039    {
00040    
00041    public:
00042 
00043       // Compiler default constructor.
00044 
00048       Signal(){};
00049   
00053       ~Signal();
00054   
00061       template <class Observer>
00062       void addObserver(Observer& observer, void (Observer::*methodPtr)(const T&));
00063 
00067       void clear();   
00068 
00072       int nObserver() const;
00073    
00084       void notify(const T& t);
00085 
00086    private:
00087    
00089       std::list<IFunctor<T>*> functorPtrs_;
00090 
00092       Signal(const Signal<T>& other);
00093 
00095       Signal<T>& operator = (const Signal<T>& other);
00096 
00097    };
00098 
00099    /*
00100    * Destructor.
00101    */
00102    template <typename T>
00103    Signal<T>::~Signal()
00104    {  clear(); }
00105 
00106    /* 
00107    * Register an observer (add to list).
00108    */
00109    template <typename T>
00110    template <class Observer> void 
00111    Signal<T>::addObserver(Observer& observer, void (Observer::*methodPtr)(const T&))
00112    {  functorPtrs_.push_back(new MethodFunctor<Observer, T>(observer, methodPtr)); }
00113 
00114    /* 
00115    * Notify observers (call associated methods).
00116    */
00117    template <typename T>
00118    void Signal<T>::notify(const T& t)
00119    {
00120       typename std::list< IFunctor<T>* >::iterator pos;
00121       pos = functorPtrs_.begin();
00122       while (pos != functorPtrs_.end())
00123       {
00124          (**pos)(t);
00125          ++pos;
00126       }
00127    }
00128 
00129    /* 
00130    * Clear all observers.
00131    *
00132    * Destroy associated functors.
00133    */
00134    template <typename T>
00135    void Signal<T>::clear()
00136    {
00137       typename std::list< IFunctor<T>* >::iterator pos;
00138       pos = functorPtrs_.begin();
00139       while (pos != functorPtrs_.end())
00140       {
00141          delete *pos;
00142          ++pos;
00143       }
00144       functorPtrs_.clear();
00145    }
00146 
00147    /* 
00148    * Get number of registered observers.
00149    */
00150    template <typename T>
00151    int Signal<T>::nObserver() const
00152    { return functorPtrs_.size(); }
00153 
00154 
00155    // -----------------------------------------------------------------
00156    // Signal with no arguments.
00157 
00167    template <>
00168    class Signal<void>
00169    {
00170    
00171    public:
00172 
00176       Signal(){};
00177 
00181       ~Signal();
00182   
00189       template <class Observer>
00190       void addObserver(Observer& observer, void (Observer::*methodPtr)());
00191    
00195       void clear();   
00196 
00200       int nObserver() const;
00201 
00205       void notify();
00206    
00207    private:
00208    
00210       std::list<IFunctor<>*> functorPtrs_;
00211 
00213       Signal(const Signal<>& other);
00214 
00216       Signal<>& operator = (const Signal<>& other);
00217 
00218    };
00219 
00220    /* 
00221    * Register an observer (add to list).
00222    */
00223    template <class Observer> void 
00224    Signal<>::addObserver(Observer& observer, void (Observer::*methodPtr)())
00225    {  functorPtrs_.push_back(new MethodFunctor<Observer>(observer, methodPtr)); }

00227 }
